com.jetdrone.vertx.yoke

Interface IMiddleware

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicAuth, BodyParser, BridgeSecureHandler, Compress, CookieParser, Cors, Csrf, ErrorHandler, Favicon, FormAuth, GBasicAuth, GFormAuth, GJWT, GRouter, JWT, Limit, Logger, MethodOverride, Middleware, RequestProxy, ResponseHeaders, ResponseTime, Router, Session, Static, Timeout, Vhost

    public interface IMiddleware

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handle(YokeRequest request, org.vertx.java.core.Handler<Object> next)
      Handles a request that is inside the chain.

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        void handle(@NotNull
          YokeRequest request,
          @NotNull
          org.vertx.java.core.Handler<Object> next)
        Handles a request that is inside the chain. Example that always returns Hello: 
         class HelloMiddleware extends Middleware {
   public void handle(YokeRequest request, Handler<Object> next) {
     request.response.end("Hello");
   }
 }
        Example that always raises an internal server error: 
         class HelloMiddleware extends Middleware {
   public void handle(YokeRequest request, Handler<Object> next) {
     next.handle("Something went wrong!");
   }
 }
        Example that passes the control to the next middleware: 
         class HelloMiddleware extends Middleware {
   public void handle(YokeRequest request, Handler<Object> next) {
     // when the error is null, then the chain will execute
     // the next Middleware until the chain is complete,
     // when that happens a 404 error is returned since no
     // middleware was found that could handle the request.
     next.handle(null);
   }
 }
        Parameters:
        request - A YokeRequest which in practice is a extended HttpServerRequest
        next - The callback to inform that the next middleware in the chain should be used. A value different from null represents an error and in that case the error handler middleware will be executed.
